info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 6:40PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Robeson, north central Dillon and east central Marlboro Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 640 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clio, or 10 miles east of Bennettsville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lumberton, Red Springs, Pembroke, Fairmont, Maxton, Mccoll, St. Pauls, Rowland, Clio, Rex, South Of The Border, Shannon, Buie, Robeson Community College, Wakulla, Elrod, Raemon, Purvis, Prospect and Barker Ten Mile. This includes Interstate 95 in North Carolina between mile markers 1 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern North Carolina...and northeastern South Carolina.
